reviews.text: Perfect in every way
Itâ€™s a good glazed donut
Hands down the most delicious donuts! We ordered donuts as dessert for our wedding and the team at Peter Pan was the absolute best to work with! We could not recommend them enough!

I was ready to be absolutely blown away by the doughnuts here and bought two to test both. Firstly, and perhaps my fault, the offer wasnâ€™t as broad as Iâ€™d hoped due to selling out. I really wanted to try glazed/plain plus one of the jam options that I did try. On both doughnuts the pastry was exceptional - mixture of light and full of flavour. Jam was too much for me - felt too processed/thick/sugary. Itâ€™s a good offer so Iâ€™d recommend trying. Queue is long but moves quick so donâ€™t be put off by that.
Fresh and delicious donuts!

ë¹ˆí‹°ì§€ ì‡¼í•‘ ì”ëœ©í•˜ê³  ë‹¹ ë–¨ì–´ì ¸ì„œ ë°©ë¬¸í•œ ë„ë„›ê°€ê²Œ. í•œêµ­ì¸ìœ¼ë¡œì„œ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ìµœê³ ì˜ ë””ì €íŠ¸ ì°¬ì‚¬. "Not too sweet, but really delicious."
Chappell Roanì˜ ë…¸ë˜ê°€ ê³„ì† ë‚˜ì˜¤ê³  ìˆì—ˆëŠ”ë°. ì§ì›ë¶„ë“¤ì´ í¥ì–¼ê±°ë¦¬ë©´ì„œ ë”°ë¼ë¶€ë¥´ëŠ” ëª¨ìŠµë„ ë„ˆë¬´ ê·€ì—½ê³  ë³´ê¸° ì¢‹ì•˜ë‹¤.
Iâ€™d definitely come back if I visit New York again.
decent donut, nice old school feel
The best
Best donuts in the universe. Nothing else compares.
They only do cash are they doing tax evasion?
Neighborhood classic.

Hands down the best donut shop. This place has that old-school Brooklyn feel, and the moment you walk in, the smell alone tells you youâ€™re in for something good. ALL the donuts are perfection â€” soft, fresh, and packed with flavor. The crew behind the counter keeps things moving fast, and you can tell they take pride in what they do.

I really wanted to like this place from all the rave reviews Iâ€™ve seen, but, all the donuts I got were either extremely dry (cake donuts), or lacked flavor (Boston crÃ¨me). Maybe it was an off day. Iâ€™d go back to try some other types.
Muy ricas donas

I have been coming to peter pan for as long as I can remember, the donuts and bagels are amazing. The service is absolutely horrible, I understand that the girls can be overwhelmed because it does get very busy but they all come across as VERY rude and not helpful. The hiring of some of the girls seems rushed as they donâ€™t seem properly trained for the crowds as well as having trouble doing the math to give you the PROPER change back (since it is a cash only establishment) they want to get you out of there as soon as possible and will give you an attitude if you take too long to decide. lastly,  CHECK YOUR ORDER before you leave everytime because recently I have been coming home from here and get the completely wrong thing from what i asked for!!!

We visited this bakery due the reviews and suggestions. We ordered glazed, chocolate cake and Bavarian cream donuts. They were good. Not amazing just good. The staff came across rude. I question the cleanliness of this establishment. It could use some updating on the decor - seems aged but not in a way I find appealing. I asked to use the restroom before leaving which they allowed (I was grateful too as I know most places do not allow this) but as the staff led me to the restroom she went inside and closed the door in my face without a word. Left me in the back of the kitchen aimlessly with no where to stand and no direction on what's next. Turns out she decided to use the restroom before me. Would have been nice for her to atleast ask me to wait there a minute. This is probably a place better to grab and go rather than dine in. Idk it wasn't my cup of tea and definitely did not have a magical PeterPan vibe to live up to such a name.

Had to go after seeing a video and it did not disappoint everything was fantastic the store was very busy the ladies where so helpful and gave great service the donuts where amazing i should have gotten more lol but just a heads up it's cash only there is a ATM across the street though
Great donuts, great prices.

My name is James. Iâ€™ve been coming here for many many many years. This is one of the best places in New York and the girls are very helpful and the owner very polite. Specially M  Blue eyes, she tried to help the customer as much as possible sweet she is one of the best. Iâ€™ll give her five ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ +all  staff work
Was excited to go here, but didnâ€™t even end up getting anything because all the donuts look dry as hell ğŸ˜­â€¦

I was in the area so I finally stopped by Peter Pan Donuts. I tried the blueberry buttermilk donut first, and honestly, it was pretty dry. Mikeâ€™s Donuts in Bay Ridge definitely does a better blueberry donut.

The apple crumble donut, though, totally saved the experience. It was excellent â€” the apple filling and pie crumb topping worked perfectly together, and it wasnâ€™t overly sweet. Definitely the highlight.

From what I saw (and tasted), their cake donuts seem to run on the dry side. Iâ€™d stick to their yeast donuts instead, since the sour cream, old fashioned, and chocolate cake donuts all looked dry too.

Customer service was fine â€” not rude, but I did have to flag someone down to get served once seated.

Overall: 3/5.
Cash only! Tasty donuts, perfect for a snack!
I ordered a untoasted bagel with scallion cream cheese,onion, tomato and lettuce and this is what I got. Not even wrapped just deli paper and tossed inside my bagğŸ‘It came like this by the way.

First and last time coming here. The food looked and tasted great but the manager Dimitris (not sure if thatâ€™s the proper spelling) was horrible to the staff. Imagine the kitchen door wide open behind where your sitting and you hear the manager screaming so loud at his own team. The other guests around me stopped doing what they were doing and we all just looked at each other. I donâ€™t know what the reason was nor do I care, that is NO way to speak to people. Literally felt like I was listening to someone who lacked so much emotional maturity lead a team that was just confused. His energy killed my vibe. Wonâ€™t be recommending anyone here. Hopefully the team members who had to deal with that wonâ€™t have to deal with it much longer.
Love this place!!

Peter Pan has been the only thing that remains the same when I visit where I lived for a decade in Greenpoint. The prices are amazing and so are the donuts. Please donâ€™t ever change Peter Pan. You are a real pillar in the community and New York legends. Maximum respect.

I so wanted to like this place but the donuts wereâ€¦. beyond mid. Their classic honey ring donut had an oily, unfresh taste and their blueberry cake donut was similarly gas station-like. The staff were super friendly and the retro vibe inside is very cute. My NYC donut search continues :(

Iâ€™ve never felt so disregarded as a customer. When I went in, I waited patiently in line, but the staff repeatedly skipped over me, helping others who walked in after I did. I tried to make eye contact and indicate I was ready to order, but I was completely ignored. Even when it was clearly my turn at the register, the employee walked away to have a conversation. It was just me in line, pretty empty around 1pm on a Monday.

When another customer walked in, staff immediately offered to help him while I was still standing there waiting. Only after I pointed out that I had been waiting did anyone acknowledge me â€” and even then, it was brushed off with a laugh.

I left without ordering. No one deserves to be treated like theyâ€™re invisible. I wonâ€™t be returning.
wo donuts my dad is a cop well he was shot down he died so anyway that why i love coffee and donuts

Large choice of donuts for a very good price.
The service is good and the honey glazed is incredible for only $2,25
Iconic doughnuts! Delicious and fresh. One thing- they donâ€™t accept credit cards, cash only
So so busy but absolutely worth it for the delicious donuts and the staff is super sweet and attentive.
Whenever you're in Greenpoint, make sure you buy your donuts from Peter Pan.
The only problem is that is cash only. The place is great. The staff is very friendly.

Honeydip is honestly amazing, I have been coming here for years especially early in the mornings the place does get crowded and sometimes the donuts run out too quickly!!! Coffee is probably the best ever!
Yummy brownie! Bosch is a sweet and kind woman.
Best donuts in NYC
Food was delicious
Overhyped if you ask me but still good quality. Service is quick and efficient. Lots of options.

Came in towards the end of the day. Heard nothing but great reviews about this place.  The service was iffy at best; teenage girls behind the counter the girl who helped me looked like they were definitely in high school. Had to ask questions more than once because it seemed like she spaced out and wanted to be anywhere else but there. The positives: the egg cream and the Red Velvet doughnut were so good! I canâ€™t state how great it was. On the downside the french cruller was just straight up nasty. They definitely used dirty oil and it was absolutely the only thing you could taste. I canâ€™t describe how bitter it was from the oil that it was one bite and in the trash. I guess you win some you loose some. It was a nice one experience but I wouldnâ€™t go out of the way to try a doughnut from here
I like the place and the costumer service. Also the donuts were amazing
I've literally had better doughnuts at a dunkin lol not worth the hype at all
The best old school donut shop! The line can be long but moves quickly. The donuts are fresh and delicious. I've never had anything i didn't like. Great service.
Always amazing
A magical experience, just like the name. Early morning is my best suggestion for best quality freshly made wholesome Greenpoint goodness. Bring cash or order online with CC.

I made the trip from Staten island because of the post of a food influencer on Instagram. I was completely disappointed, all 6 donuts that we got had little to no flavor, the only one with some flavor was the toasted coconut.
Cash only in this day and age
Itâ€™s a solid staple
Miejsce niewygledne, natomiast wypieki sÄ… przepyszne!

Everything is great about this place. First, the donut was really, really good. I tried the traditional glazed, and it was honestly incredible. Secondly, the service was super friendly and helpful. The girl behind the counter was really kind. Last but not least, it's hard to beat their prices, especially in NYC.

Les donuts les plus gÃ©nÃ©reux que jâ€™ai eu lâ€™occasion de manger. Ils sont trÃ¨s gros (et pas trÃ¨s chers) et ont un bon goÃ»t de friture faite maison, sans pour autant Ãªtre Ã©cÅ“urants. Lâ€™apple fritter Ã©tait un vrai nuage Ã  lâ€™intÃ©rieur et croustillant juste comme il faut Ã  lâ€™extÃ©rieur, avec la bonne quantitÃ© de glaÃ§age de pommes et de cannelle. Lâ€™apple crumble donut Ã©tait vraiment fondant avec une compote de pommes parsemÃ©e de morceaux, plein de saveurs et de texture. La quantitÃ© de crumble Ã  la cannelle sur le dessus Ã©tait indÃ©cente (de la meilleure des maniÃ¨res) et le crumble se mariait parfaitement avec la pomme. Il y a gÃ©nÃ©ralement un peu de queue mais elle rÃ©trÃ©cit rapidement. Attention toutefois, ils ne prennent pas la carte.

The iconic Peter Pan was packed on this perfect picturesque day. The donuts are huge, delicious and reasonably priced. The crazy long line moved super fast. Dressed in bright colored smocks the donut specialists (?) were friendly and easily handled the multiple hungry customers on line. These donuts are so so good. Enjoy

We visited here on a Sunday morning around 11 am, just before the lunch rush. I was hoping to order an apple fritter, but they ran out, so I ordered a honey dip and a lemon filled donut, which was generously filled. The texture of the donuts was soft and chewy, making it a perfect snack! I loved the old-fashioned diner vibes with the barstools and decor. This joint was reasonably priced, especially considering the price of quality pastries in NYC, but I would definitely recommend visiting early in the morning for a greater selection of flavors. I would definitely recommend visiting Greenpoint Toys across the street with its wide array of toys for all ages.

Was recommended by NYPD cop and wanted to like it, but was trash food. Went there late AM July 28 and it was the first and only thing I ate that day. Had coffee, red velvet donut but marble cruller was off, really oily from the fryer and just bad tasting chocolate. But that was enough to upset stomach and started vomiting later so everything came out until nothing left. Otherwise, staff was wonderful, prices good, cool atmosphere... but we'll never go back.
Oh my Goodness! The donuts ğŸ˜ my favourite was the coconut cream! Definitely would go again to try out the other flavours! 1 donut is $2.25

Peter Pan Donuts is our go-to breakfast spotâ€”my daughter and I canâ€™t get enough! The donuts are absolutely delicious, always fresh, and pair perfectly with the casual, welcoming vibe. Weâ€™re also obsessed with their bacon, egg, and cheese sandwichesâ€”seriously, some of the best around.

Everything is so affordable. The staff are friendly, the place has that classic diner charm, and itâ€™s just a joy to start our day here. Highly recommend for anyone who loves great food and a laid-back atmosphere.

Es la cafeterÃ­a que apareciÃ³  en Spider-Man No Way Home, Si eres fan de Spider-Man seguro te va a gustar tomar fotos aquÃ­, decidimos entrar y el staff te da recomendaciones de quÃ© pedir si no sabes entre tantas opciones.

Hay una barra de cafÃ© al fondo para sentarse y beber cafÃ©.

â™¿La entrada es accesible para personas en silla de ruedas.

I stop here every time Iâ€™m in the neighborhood. Soft delicious donuts (toasted coconuts is my favorite), good cheap coffee, and classic bagels. Must visit, great service, very low-key and I always feel so happy there!

Old school donut, pastry and bagel shop. A long time neighborhood staple.

Great place to grab some sweets and always full staffed and service with a smile.

Donuts are amazing! Bagels are amazing! Coffee amazing! Hot coco amazing! The Bacon egg and cheese is delicious! The brownie was delightful. However, it had nuts. I have an allergy as so unfortunately I could not consume it once I took the first bite and saw it. The service was very good. The girls are super friendly and patient with you while you choose what you want.

My two boys enjoyed everything and so did I !

I will be going back when ever given the opportunity <3

$1.95 for one of the BEST donuts youâ€™ll ever have? Sweet deal.

Their Blueberry Buttermilk donut is a KNOCKOUT. So flavorful and an amazing texture. Glazed and crispy on the outside, moist and dense in the best kind of way within.

This place was so good we waited in line to try their Maple donut too. Also delicious but not as special as the blueberry one.

The place is cute and has an old timey diner vibe too!
objectively the donuts are good and tasty. need to purchase 6 to get a boxâ€¦ or maybe they were just tryna upsell me. whatever i ate all 6 anyway.

Peter Pan Donut & Pastry Shop is a Greenpoint treasure, one of the oldest bakeries in Brooklyn, serving freshly baked, high-quality donuts, pastries, and egg sandwiches at low prices. Everything is handcrafted on-site, from classic glazed donuts to fluffy crullers and hearty breakfast rolls. This iconic Greenpoint bakery offers unbeatable value and a charming, retro vibe. A must-visit for the best donuts in Brooklyn! Highly recommend this local gem for its fresh, delicious treats.

They are known for the delicious doughnuts. I usually get the honey glazed, I went with the old fashioned glazed today. The toasted coconut is also amazing. The everything flagle is bomb. Tasty with a satisfying crunch!

excellent yeasted donuts! would recommend the coconut cream and honey dip donuts for sure - especially the latter if you like plain glazed donuts. i was afraid the coconut cream was going to be too heavy or too sweet but it was actually quite light and fluffy. the red velvet and sour cream donuts were pretty good as well, but we just aren't big fans of cake donuts. one of the servers offered us water when she saw us eating the cake donuts which was a nice gesture. cumulatively this came out to under 8 dollars. would go again for the yeasted donuts!

Iâ€™ve been coming here for ages, before the lines would wrap around outside. Itâ€™s delicious and worth it. I just popped in for a coconut cream donut, it was so delicious and not cloyingly sweet the way many other places can be. It was delicious, and had nice fluffy coconut flakes on the top. My dadâ€™s favorite from here was the crumb cake. You can see a huge slab of it when you walk in. Some additional notes, there is some seating here but it is limited. Thereâ€™s also bagels of course and breakfast sandwiches such as the bacon egg and cheese that I didnâ€™t notice referenced anywhere in the store menus, but a guy seated there was enjoying one and another nearby child told his mom he wanted one too. Such a great classic spot in the neighborhood, theyâ€™ve been here for a while and it shows, great quality. The lines can be crazy but they move faster than youâ€™d think, just plan accordingly, also CASH ONLY! They mention it many times in there but I will too!

I get the hype. The blueberry cake donut really has a blueberry flavor that doesn't taste artificial. And the yeast doughnuts are very fluffy, not greasy, and fresh tasting. The strawberry frosting also tasted non-artificial which wasâ€¦

This a typical donut shop popular in the 70s-80s. Nothing special other than it gives you that nostalgic feeling. Donuts are normal, sweet, and delish but nothing over the top. If you are a tourist, sure it's worth a visit. But if you were born and raised in NY, you would not be wowed.

As classic as a donut shop can get! As soon as you walk up to the storefront, you know this place is something special. Walk inside to be greeted by a good line, classic donut, shop, counter, seating, and a bunch of ladies and old school uniforms, eager to help you choose your sweet culinary delight. Strongly recommend the sour cream donut, coffee cake, and cream chocolate sprinkle (reminds me of an old school 7 minute frosting with sprinkles on top). Also the best French crueler Iâ€™ve ever had in my life. Went on a Saturday and Monday this go round and itâ€™s fun as a visitor seeing the difference between the Saturday crowd (super busy and lots of visitors) versus Monday (more locals on their way to work and folks who know each other). The world needs more places like Peter Pan Donut.

I really liked Peter Pan bakery! This is a classic bakery with a vintage 1950s vibes to it. Whenever I come here, I always get the red velvet donut, which is delicious. This donut is not too messy and has a classic taste to it. This place can get very busy at times and usually has a long line. It is also really hard to find seating in the bakery since all the seats are usually taken. But waiting on the line for 10-15 minutes is worth it since the donut is really good and really priced well. The donuts are only $1.25 and also tastes really well! These donuts beat Dunkin Donuts any day, and has a better classic and authentic taste to it. Itâ€™s also much cheaper than Dunkin Donuts as well.

Price:$1.25ğŸ’¸
Rating: 8/10ğŸ“

We hit up Peter Pan in Brooklyn twiceâ€”yeah, itâ€™s that good! Perfect breakfast spot with amazing prices, delicious coffee, and super friendly staff. The vibes here are unbeatable.

Our top picks? The Blueberry and the French Crullerâ€”absolute must-tries. Honestly, this place is easily one of the best highlights in New York. If youâ€™re in the city, donâ€™t skip it!

Check out both visits here: Link 1 and Link 2

If I lived nearby I would probably visit every single morningâ€¦ Old fashioned donuts with a twist. You can tell how much love goes into their place. Thereâ€™s an old school vibe when you walk into the pastry shop. As soon as you enter, theâ€¦

This place is an absolute gem if you want to eat some of the best donuts you've ever had and wash them down with a cup of solid, no frills coffee. Do yourself a favor and grab a seat for the full experience.

What a fantastic experience! We walked in and it was packed and a small space, but the service was so fast and efficient. All of the ladies working were so sweet and gave good suggestions. We sat at the counter and had our food in no time. I got a cream cheese and lox bagel, and my partner had an egg and cheese. Iâ€™m going to dream about that bagel for years to come! We also grabbed a half dozen doughnuts to go. Every staff member was friendly, helpful, and on point. Highly recommend adding to your to-try list!
